      • req

        public java.lang.String req(java.lang.String name)
        Abbreviation of the [ ServletRequest.getParameter(String) ] method.
        Parameters:
        name - (String) The same as request.getParameter(columnName).
        Returns:
        (String) Parameter String value.

      • reqInt

        public int reqInt(java.lang.String name)

      • reqInt

        public int reqInt(java.lang.String name,
                  int ifNull)

      • reqInt

        public int reqInt(java.lang.String name,
                  int ifNull,
                  java.lang.Integer min,
                  java.lang.Integer max)
        Get int from request with default value.

        Get int from request.
        When parameter is null will give a customize default value or auto 0.
        And it can limit the min and max value by optionally.
        The method will never throw any Exception. All possible Exception will become default value.

        Parameters:
        name - (String) Column name of the request parameter.
        ifNull - (String) Default value when the parameter is null or unparseable. [optionally]
        min - (Integer) Min value of the parameter value [optionally].
        max - (Integer) Max value of the parameter value [optionally].
        Returns:
        (int) Parameter value or default.

      • reqLong

        public long reqLong(java.lang.String name,
                    long ifNull,
                    java.lang.Long min,
                    java.lang.Long max)
        Get long from request with default value.

        Get long from request.
        When parameter is null will give a customize default value or auto 0.
        And it can limit the min and max value by optionally.
        The method will never throw any Exception. All possible Exception will become default value.

        Parameters:
        name - (String) Column name of the request parameter.
        ifNull - (String) Default value when the parameter is null or unparseable. [optionally]
        min - (Long) Min value of the parameter value [optionally].
        max - (Long) Max value of the parameter value [optionally].
        Returns:
        (long) Parameter value or default.

      • reqString

        public java.lang.String reqString(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String ifNull,
                                  java.lang.Integer mLength)
        Get String from request with default value.

        Get String from request.
        When parameter is null will give a customize default value or auto empty string "".
        And it can limit max length of the String by optionally.
        The method will never throw any Exception. All possible Exception will become default String.

        Parameters:
        name - (String) Column name of the request parameter.
        ifNull - (String) Default value when the parameter is null [optionally].
        mLength - (int) Max String length of the parameter value [optionally].
        Returns:
        (String) Parameter value or default.

      • reqSqlString

        public java.lang.String reqSqlString(java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String ifNull,
                                     java.lang.Integer mLength)
        Get SQL format String from request.
        Parameters:
        name - (String) Column name of the request parameter.
        ifNull - (String) Default value when the parameter is null or unparseable. [optionally]
        mLength - (Integer) Max length limit of returned data. Defaulted unlimit. [optionally]
        Returns:
        (String) SQL format srting.

      • reqDate

        public java.util.Date reqDate(java.lang.String name,
                              java.util.Date ifNull,
                              int mode)
        Parameters:
        name - (String) Column name of the request parameter.
        ifNull - (Date) Default value when the parameter is null or unparseable. [optionally]
        mode - (int) 0:auto, 1:AC year, 2:TW year. Default:0
        Returns:
        (Date) Java Date object or null.

      • appInt

        public int appInt(java.lang.String name)

      • appInt

        public int appInt(java.lang.String name,
                  int ifNull)
        Get int from Application with default value.

        Get int from Application.
        When attribute is null or unparseable will give a customize default value or initialize 0.
        The method will never throw any Exception. All possible Exception will replace to default value.

        Parameters:
        name - (String) Column name of the Application attribute.
        ifNull - (int) Default value when the Application attribute is null or unparseable. Defaulted 0. [optionally]
        Returns:
        (int) int data return from Application.

      • reqSesInt

        public int reqSesInt(java.lang.String name)

      • reqSesInt

        public int reqSesInt(java.lang.String name,
                     int ifNull)
        Get int from Request or session cache with default value.

        Get int from Request parameter and save a session cache.
        When parameter is null or unparseable will give a customize default value or initialize 0.
        The method will never throw any Exception. All possible Exception will replace to default value.

        Parameters:
        name - (String) Column name of the Request parameter.
        ifNull - (int) Default value when both the Request parameter and session cache are null or unparseable. Defaulted 0. [optionally]
        Returns:
        (int) Data return from Request/cache.

      • setReqSesInt

        public JspIO setReqSesInt(java.lang.String name,
                          int val)
        Save a int Request parameter cache into session.
        Parameters:
        name - (String) Column name of the Request parameter.
        val - (int) Inputed cache value.
        Returns:
        (JspIO) JspIO object self.

        Throws:

             throws java.lang.Exception

        Throws:

      • setExcel

        public void setExcel(java.lang.String fileName,
                     java.lang.String sheetName,
                     java.lang.Integer splitY)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Set a Response to attachment HTML Excel(.xls) file with utf8 charset, and give attachment file name.
        Parameters:
        fileName - (String) csv file name.
        sheetName - (String) Name of first sheet.
        splitY - (Integer) If more than 1 split sheet row with customize value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any exception.
